intro: Anomopanax digitatus, commonly known as the five-finger tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which consist of five to seven lobes resembling fingers, hence its common name. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and the plant produces dark blue or black berries that are edible.
